result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian J Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian J Cruz

Defendant Christian J Cruz in court with attorney Sheila M. Smith.  Defendant Christian J Cruz in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Defense requests bond modification. 
State does not not object to bond modification. 
BTC: Defendant is orderd to attend CCV class on 10/24/15. 
Bond modification is granted. Bond is modified to a $2000.00 signature bond. Same conditions apply but to include: No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must attend CCV class on 10/3/15.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
